meanings.sent1: The brulzie between the two siblings could be heard throughout the house.
meanings.sent2: The neighbors called the police to stop the brulzie happening next door.
meanings.sent3: The brulzie over the last piece of cake was both amusing and unnecessary.
meanings.sent4: The brulzie at the soccer game resembled a pack of wild animals fighting over food.
meanings.sent5: The brulzie at the market was so chaotic that people had to step back to avoid getting involved.

meanings.definition: To engage in a noisy quarrel or brawl.
meanings.sent1: They brulzied over who should do the dishes after dinner.
meanings.sent2: The kids tend to brulzie whenever they have to share toys.
meanings.sent3: The siblings brulzied playfully over who could jump higher on the trampoline.
meanings.sent4: The two teams brulzied fiercely on the field, each determined to win.
meanings.sent5: The politicians brulzied during the debate, trying to make their points heard over the others.
